review_blob: Bottle poured into tulip glass. Pours a hazy golden with thin white head. Aromas of apricot jam, orange zest, yeast, and hay. Flavors are the same with a tart blast and a fruity white wine (Chablis, pinot grigio) feeling. Very tasty and funky stuff.

Growler from the source. Pours a beautiful, creamy orange with foamy white head and a small amount of lacing. Aromas of mango, melon, earth, gumdrops, and funk. Flavors are the same with the most juicy and pulpy mango/orange juice ever, lemon rind, and barnyard. Incredibly tart, yet juicy and super tasty. Superb stuff.

Pour from a fresh bomber bottle. Pours a hazy golden with a creamy white head and heavy lacing. Aroma of freshly picked peaches and caramel. Flavor offers a massive sweet Peach punch followed by a drier orange rind and pine needles. Finish is long and quite dry. Superbly done by a top notch Brewery.

Growler from the source. Pours a typical TH hazy golden with a creamy white head. Aromas of grass, scallion, cantelope, and green pepper. Flavors are the same plus guava, mango, hay, and honeydew. Really tasty and complex. Great IPA.

Bottled 10/17/2008. Pours a hazy Amber with thin bubbly head. Aromas of cherry jolly rancher, biscuits, fruit basket. Flavors are similar plus plum, apple cider vinegar (in a good way), and  sweet oak. Finish is fruity, tart cherry, oaky, tannic, and long. This is by far one of the great beer tasting experiences in my life and totally worth a perfect beer score. Absolutely no faults or imperfections in this brew. Happy New Year!!!

Bomber from Quality Liquor. Pours a slightly hazy, bubbly gold with thin white head and moderate lacing. Aromas of grapefruit, tangerine, and cantelope. Flavors are similar plus honeydew melon, grass, and some pine needles. Finishes rather dry. Super smooth. Really good stuff.
Bottle from Wegmans. Pours black with thin head and lacing. Aromas of dark chocolate and caramel chews. Flavors are the same with a light saltiness and some bonfire. Really nice winter dessert brew.

Growler from the source. Pours hazy milky golden with creamy head and soapy lacing. Aromas of coconut, papaya, and guava. Tastes are similar plus a bit of citrus and spice. I immediately think of a Hoppy Pina Colada. Interesting brew.

Growler from the source. Pours hazy golden with massive creamy white head and soapy lacing. Aromas of mango puree, orange zest, and pinecone. Flavors are similar plus sweet green pepper and dry citrus rind. Fantastic. One of their best.
beer_name: Tired Hands Waiting For The Bloom

review_blob: 8.0% version. Growler from the source. Pours hazy golden with creamy head and moderate lacing. Aromas of melon and pineapple. Flavors are the same plus kiwi, guava, coconut, and orange Tang. Finish is long, tropical, and dry. Incredible stuff here. This should be a year round brew.
Growler from the source. Pours a slightly hazy gold with thin white head. Aromas of Pear, kumquat, chardonnay. Flavors are the same with a grape skin tartness and funk. Delicious beer.

Growler from the source. Pours golden with white foamy head. Aroma of orange rind and grapefruit. Flavors are the same plus pine and a slight caramel sweetness and sharp spicy bite. Quite nice. Good use of the Centennial Hop.
Growler pour. Pours an extremely hazy gold packed with foam and lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, grass, and sweet scallion. Flavors are the same plus fresh sliced green pepper and bubblegum. Great stuff.

From bomber. Pours a typical golden color with a massive foamy head and bubbly lacing. Aroma is honeydew melon, pineapple, and orange rind. Taste is the same with a dash of pepper and the classic Belgium yeasty funkiness. Very nice brew. Complex and refreshing.

Growler from the source. Pours ebony with nice tan lacing. Aromas of coffee, chocolate, and vanilla. Flavors are the same with the creamiest delivery I have had in a milk Stout. And the delicious aftertaste of a rich chocolate covered pretzel. I would honestly put this up against any milk/ chocolate Stout out there. Absolutely superb. Blows my mind.

Growler from the source. Pours a pink lemonade color with a quickly dissipating head. Aromas of sour cherry juice, earth, and salt water. Flavors are the same with some rhubarb and black pepper mixed in. Finishes dry, acidic, and tart. A masterpiece in my book. So drinkable and packed with flavor.
beer_name: Tired Hands Freedom From the Known

review_blob: Growler from the source. Pours hazy golden with medium white head. Aromas of scallion, earth, slight lemon. Flavors are the same plus a touch of tangarine and honey. Superbly dry, vegetal, and dank. Very nice indeed.
Growler from the source. Pours a hazy orange with thick white head. Aroma of mango, tangarine, and grass. Flavors are the same plus some pine. Semi dry citrusy finish. Refreshing and delicious.

From bomber. Pours a golden color with medium head. Aromas of vanilla, pine nuts, and subtle fruit. Flavor absolutely explodes with demerara sugars, tropical fruits, and earthy. Just incredible. A+++++
Pour from bomber. Pours golden with thick soapy head. Aromas of faint tangarine and hay. Flavor is super dry, grainy, and earthy. Finishes with a burst of bubble gum and kumquat. I really like this.
Bottle pour. Pours a hazy gold. Aromas of hay and lemon. Flavors are the same plus sour peach and grape plus some soft earthy mint. Super complex and tasty stuff. Funky for sure. A great.

Growler from Als/Pizza Boy. Pours light gold with white head. Aromas of lemon drop candy, grain, and funk. Flavors are the same with citrusy hops, lemon rind, and dry brett deliciousness. Super rindy, lemony, funky, and refreshing. Fantastic beer

Growler from the Brewpub. Pours gold with thin creamy head. Aromas of farm fresh peach and hay. Flavors are the same plus corn husk, a bit of lemon, and some rock candy sweetness. Finishes tangy and earthy. Solid but not my favorite from the TH crew.

Growler from the brewery. Pours murky, hazy golden with medium creamy head. Aromas of mango, strawberry shortcake, and some kiwi. Flavors are the same plus citrus, Werthers Originals, and some pine notes. Super complex. An amazing combination of sweet, citrus, and dry. Great collaboration brew.
beer_name: Tired Hands / Omnipollo Milkshake IPA - Strawberry

review_blob: Growler fill from the brewery. Pours yellow gold with thin head. Aromas of yeast, ripe banana, and kiwi. Flavors are the same plus some vegetal notes ( green tomato) and sugary fruits at the end along with a light rindy tartness. Beautifully done fresh Saison. Right up my alley

Growler from the brewery. Pours a hazy golden with medium white head. Aromas of mango, pine, and orange zest. Flavors are the same plus a dry citrusy bitterness and a touch of bright nectarine. Finishes medium dry with a bunch of citrus rind. Tons of flavor in this one.
Batch 011. Pours golden with thin head. Aromas of fresh fruit, honey, and yeast. Flavors are the same plus banana, cinnamon, and cloves. Super smooth and delicious.
Pours hazy gold with frothy head. Aromas of papaya, vanilla, and oak. Flavors are the same with brett funk and smooth oak finish. Super solid brew.

Bottle poured into tulip. Pours milky golden with small thin white head. Aromas of pineapple, bubblegum, mango, and barnyard funk. Flavors are the same plus some sour pear and oaky goodness. Finishes dry, tart, and funky. Delicious

Growler from the brewery. Pours hazy golden with medium head. Aromas of peach, pineapple, bubblegum, and slight garlic. Flavors are the same plus a lip-smacking melony explosion. Finishes with some citrusy additions. Just about perfect in my book. Jean and the guys do such a great job with IPAs.

Bottle pour into proper glass wear. Pours amber brown with practically no head. Aromas of fresh baked bread, pipe tobacco, nougat, and fresh fruit. Flavor is the same plus a lingering cascade of roasted malt with a nutty aftertaste. This is almost exactly what I remember an Altbier tasting like when I visited Dusseldorf. Fantastic beer.

Poured into stem glass from 23 oz bomber. Pours dark amber with medium creamy head and moderate lacing. Aromas of maple, chocolate, pine needles, and caramel. Flavors are the same plus raison, orange, and mango. Great malt/ hop balance. Fantastic amber ale.

Growler from the brewery. Pours a hazy gold with small white head. Aromas of Meyers lemon, grapefruit sorbet, and zippy yeast. Flavors are the same plus some dry spices and citrus zest. Dry, pungent, and flavorful. Fantastic.

Growler from the brewery. Pours reddish brown with medium creamy head. Aromas of bread, honeysuckle, and earl gray tea. Flavors are similar along with chewing tobacco and earthy minerals. This is a stunner. Probably the best bitter I have tried in a long time. Fantastic

2013 bottle. Pours pitch black with foamy white head. Aromas of rye whiskey, caramel, and oak. Flavors are similar with anise and a tad of peat and suet. Finish is long tobacco, peat, and bourbon. Amazing

Growler from the brewery. Pours almost ruby red with thin head and mild lacing. Aromas of tart cherries and wheat. Flavors are similar plus orange rind, hibiscus syrup, and a dash of cinnamon or nutmeg. Nice and refreshing. Another top notch Saison from TH.

Bottled in 12/14. Pours orangy gold with medium white head. Aromas of cedar and caramel. Flavors are similar plus some grapefruit and melon??? Was expecting more especially since it is not even 2 months old. OK
beer_name: Karl Strauss Big Barrel Double IPA

review_blob: Bottled 2 weeks ago. Pours hazy gold with thin white head. Aromas of roasted garlic, sweet red onions, caramel popcorn, orange zest, pine trees and melon. Flavors are the same plus a bitter citrus bite. Really unique and delicious.
Pours hazy golden with creamy white head and a massive amount of lacing. Aromas of pine, mango, and melon. Flavors are the same plus wildflower honey and hoppy bite. Delicious brew.

Draft from the source. Pours nearly pitch black with medium head and soapy lacing. Aromas of bourbon, bakers chocolate, and vanilla beans. Flavors are the same with the most luxurious dark chocolate truffle amidst some pecan and a dash of spice from the bourbon. The epitome of a desert beer. Astonishing.
beer_name: Heavy Seas Uncharted Waters: Siren Noire (2013 -)

review_blob: Pours golden and champagne like with small white head. Aromas of tart fruit, pepper, and bright funk. Flavors are similar plus tart apple skin and bread. Delicious beer

Growler fill. Pours black with bubbly head and moderate lacing. Aromas of pine, oranges, mango, and dark chocolate. Flavors are similar plus slightly burnt bakers chocolate, figs, and lots of citrus. Finishes very long and citrusy. Delicious. I wish more Black IPAs were like this

Growler from brewery. Pours hazy golden with minimal head. Aromas of apple brandy, pear puree, and barnyard. Flavors are similar plus citrus acidity and sugary lemon rind. Finishes both tart and sweet. Nice beer.
beer_name: Tired Hands Apparent Ego Yard Sale

review_blob: Pour from 22 oz bottle. Aroma is ridiculous with mango, pine needles, fresh cut grass, guava, and maybe even butterscotch pudding. Flavors are similar plus honey and nougat mixed with a citrusy melange and a hoppy dryness. Finish is long, citrusy, dry and lip smackingly delicious. Super tasty and smooth for 9.4%. Superb beer

Pours orangy golden with white lacing. Aromas of mango, papaya, clementine, and fresh cut grass. Flavors are the same with a bitter hop bite and pine needles. Very complex. Great IPA from an underrated brewery.
Pours golden orange with white fizzy head. Aromas of nectarine, red peppers, and mango. Flavors are similar plus lemon zest, guava, and some spice. Finishes dry and refreshing. Really nice Saison

Pours almost pitch black with tan head. Aromas of anise, hay, and soda pop. Flavors are similar with tart grape skins and almost a tawny port like quality. A ton going on here. Lots of fruit in the finish (especially prune) and chewing tobacco. Massive depth and complexity. Delicious

Bottle pour. Pours a bubbly golden with a huge creamy white head. Aroma is champagne like with some citrus lime zest and tart apple. Flavors are similar with some spice upfront followed by a slightly sour, dry, and yeasty finish. A nice beer.

Growler fill from the brewery. Pours a hazy golden with creamy white head. Aromas of citrus, melon, and mango. Flavors are the same plus a bit of sweetness. Finish is long, fruity, and semi-dry. Another TH winner.

From bottle Best After 12/6/14. Pours hazy orangy golden with thin white head. Aromas of green apple, ripe berries, chardonnay. Flavors are similar plus tart cider, sugar plums, yeasty funk, and amazing oak. Finishes dry, fruity, and slightly tart. Incredibly complex and refreshing. One of the best Belgian Style Ales I have ever had.
beer_name: Deschutes Class of 88 Belgian Style Ale
